page.title: 01General Review of Area
page.content: Our 12 square kilometre area is mainly agricultural land, the main crops being wheat and barley. There is just one village, Hatfield Heath which is situated in the north-west. This is a picturesque village which is extremely popular with tourists, especially in the summer and six different roads converge on the Heath. The A1060 travels from north-west to south-east across the block, the road crossing Pincey Brook roughly in the middle of the area. There are several farms, a sewage works and a large abattoir. There are a variety of different dwellings and a selection of listed buildings including Lea Hall and Ongars which are both mentioned in the original Domesday Book. With the news that Stansted Airport is to be developed, villagers are aware of inevitable changes to the area.
